summary.para: Adds a topology to the end of the queue.

param.name: pTopology
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the topology. This pointer cannot be NULL. If an application passes NULL, the call fails with an E_INVALIDARG error code.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A combination of flags from the enumeration.

param.name: pdwId
param.para: Receives the sequencer element identifier for this topology.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The source topology node is missing one of the following attributes:

remarks.para: The sequencer plays topologies in the order they are queued. You can queue as many topologies as you want to preroll.

The application must indicate to the sequencer when it has queued the last topology on the Media Session. To specify the last topology, set the SequencerTopologyFlags_Last flag in the dwFlags parameter when you append the topology. The sequencer uses this information to end playback with the pipeline. Otherwise, the sequencer waits indefinitely for a new topology to be queued.

summary.para: Deletes a topology from the queue.

param.name: dwId
param.para: The sequencer element identifier of the topology to delete.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Maps a presentation descriptor to its associated sequencer element identifier and the topology it represents.

param.name: pPD
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the presentation descriptor.

param.name: pId
param.para: Receives the sequencer element identifier. This value is assigned by the sequencer source when the application calls . This parameter is optional and can be NULL.

param.name: ppTopology
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the original topology that the application added to the sequencer source. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can receive the value NULL if the sequencer source has switched to the next presentation. This parameter is optional and can be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The presentation descriptor is not valid.

remarks.para: The topology returned in ppTopology is the original topology that the application specified in . The source nodes in this topology contain pointers to the native sources. Do not queue this topology on the Media Session. Instead, call to get the sequencer source's modified topology. The source nodes in the modified topology contain pointers to the sequencer source, rather than the native sources.

summary.para: Updates a topology in the queue.

param.name: dwId
param.para: Sequencer element identifier of the topology to update.

param.name: pTopology
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the updated topology object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The sequencer source has been shut down.

remarks.para: This method is asynchronous. When the operation is completed, the sequencer source sends an MESequencerSourceTopologyUpdated event.

summary.para: Updates the flags for a topology in the queue.

param.name: dwId
param.para: Sequencer element identifier of the topology to update.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Bitwise OR of flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Implemented by the Sequencer Source. The sequencer source enables an application to create a sequence of topologies. To create the sequencer source, call . For step-by-step instructions about how to create a playlist, see How to Create a Playlist.
